entity_combined: Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA)

entity_combined: Department for General Assembly and Conference Management (DGACM)

entity_long: Department of Global Communications

entity_combined: Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance (DMSPC)

entity_long: Department of Operational Support
entity_combined: Department of Operational Support (DOS)

entity_combined: Department of Peace Operations (DPO)
entity_description: The DPO is dedicated to assisting the Member States and the Secretary-General in their efforts to maintain international peace and security.

entity_long: Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs
entity_combined: Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA)

entity_long: Department of Safety and Security
entity_combined: Department of Safety and Security (DSS)

head_of_entity_title_specific: Under-Secretary-General for Safety and Security

entity_long: Economic Commission for Africa
entity_combined: Economic Commission for Africa (ECA)
entity_description: The ECA's mandate is to promote the economic and social development of its member States, foster intra-regional integration, and promote international cooperation for Africa's development.

entity_long: Economic Commission for Europe
entity_combined: Economic Commission for Europe (ECE)
entity_description: As a multilateral platform, UNECE facilitates greater economic integration and cooperation among its member countries and promotes sustainable development and economic prosperity.

entity_long: Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean
entity_combined: Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC)
entity_description: The ECLAC coordinates policies for the promotion of sustainable Latin American and Carriibean economic development and to foster regional and international trade.

entity_long: Ethics Office
entity_combined: Ethics Office (EO)
entity_description: The UN Ethics Office promotes an ethical organizational culture based on UN’s core values of integrity, professionalism and respect for diversity, and the values outlined in Standards of Conduct for the International Civil Service, which include independence, loyalty, impartiality, integrity, accountability and respect for human rights. The Ethics Office assists the Secretary-General in ensuring that all staff members perform their functions consistent with the highest standards of integrity as required by the Charter of the United Nations.

entity_long: Executive Office of the Secretary-General
entity_combined: Executive Office of the Secretary-General (EOSG)
entity_description: The EOSG assists the Secretary-General with relations with members and organs of the United Nations and with specialized agencies and non-governmental organizations, as well as to assist with policy and coordination of the Secretariat.

entity_long: Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific
entity_combined: Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP)
entity_description: ESCAP serves as the regional arm of the UN in economic, social and related fields, it promotes the inclusive and sustainable economic and social development in the Asia-Pacific region

entity_long: Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia
entity_combined: Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (ESCWA)
entity_description: The purpose of ESCWA is to stimulate economic activity in member countries, strengthen cooperation between them and promote development.

entity_long: Food and Agriculture Organization
entity_combined: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)
entity_description: The FAO aims to: raise levels of nutrition and standards of living secure improvements in food production and distribution better the conditions of rural people and contribute toward an expanding world economy and ensure freedom from hunger.

entity_combined: Group of Experts on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (GoE-DRC)

entity_combined: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)

entity_long: International Civil Aviation Organization
entity_combined: International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO)
entity_description: The ICAO is charged with developing international air navigation and fostering the planning and development of international air transport to ensure the growth of international civil aviation.

entity_long: International Criminal Court
entity_combined: International Criminal Court (ICC)
entity_description: ​The ICC investigates and tries individuals charged with the gravest crimes of concern to the international community: genocide, war crimes, crimes against humanity and the crime of aggression.

entity_long: International Court of Justice
entity_combined: International Court of Justice (ICJ)
entity_description: The Court’s role is to settle legal disputes submitted to it by States and to give advisory opinions on legal questions referred to it by authorized United Nations organs and specialized agencies.

entity_long: International Civil Service Commission
entity_combined: International Civil Service Commission (ICSC)
entity_description: The ICSC's focus is to strengthen and maintain high standards in the international civil service, while balancing the needs and concerns of its major stakeholders.

entity_long: International Fund for Agricultural Development
entity_combined: International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD)
entity_description: The IFAD is an international financial institution and UN specialised agency dedicated to eradicating poverty in rural areas of developing countries.

entity_combined: International, Impartial and Independent Mechanism to Assist in the Investigation and Prosecution of Persons Responsible for the Most Serious Crimes under International Law Committed in the Syrian Arab Republic since March 2011 (IIIM)

entity_long: International Labor Organization
entity_combined: International Labor Organization (ILO)

entity_long: International Monetary Fund
entity_combined: International Monetary Fund (IMF)

entity_long: International Maritime Organization
entity_combined: International Maritime Organization (IMO)
entity_description: The IMO is responsible for the safety of life at sea, maritime security and the protection of the marine environment through prevention of sea pollution caused by ships.

entity_long: International Organization for Migration
entity_combined: International Organization for Migration (IOM)
entity_description: The IOM is the leading intergovernmental organization in the field of migration and is committed to the principle that humane and orderly migration benefits migrants and society.

entity_long: International Seabed Authority
entity_combined: International Seabed Authority (ISA)
entity_description: The ISA is mandated under the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea to organize, regulate and control all mineral-related activities in the international seabed area for the benefit of mankind as a whole.

entity_long: International Trade Centre
entity_combined: International Trade Centre (ITC)
entity_description: The ITC supports the United Nations and WTO's regulatory research and policy strategies, and focuses on implementing and delivering trade related technical assistance projects (TRTA).

entity_long: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea
entity_combined: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS)
entity_description: The ITLOS is an independent judicial body established by the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea to adjudicate disputes regarding all ocean space, its uses and resources.

entity_long: International Telecommunication Union
entity_combined: International Telecommunication Union (ITU)
entity_description: The ITU is an inter-governmental organization that brings together governments and industry to coordinate the establishment and operation of global telecommunication networks and services.

entity_long: Joint Inspection Unit
entity_combined: Joint Inspection Unit (JIU)
entity_description: The JIU is the only independent external oversight body of the United Nations system mandated to conduct evaluations, inspections and investigations system-wide.

entity_long: United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara
entity_combined: United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara (MINURSO)

entity_combined: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA)

entity_combined: United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC)

entity_combined: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)

entity_long: United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research
entity_combined: United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDIR)
entity_description: The UNIDIR is an autonomous body of the UN, established by the General Assembly to carry out independent research on disarmament and related international security issues.
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council

entity_long: United Nations Industrial Development Organization
entity_combined: United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)
entity_description: The UNIDO is the UN specialized agency mandated to promote industrial development and international industrial cooperation.

entity_long: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon
entity_combined: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL)
entity_description: UNIFIL was created to confirm Israeli withdrawal from Lebanon, restore international peace and security and assist the Lebanese Government in restoring its effective authority in the area.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
entity_combined: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA)
entity_description: UNISFA enhances the peace and stability, through operations to ensure that the Abyei Area is weapons-free and reducing intercommunal tensions by employing conflict prevention measures and promoting dialogue.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Institute for Training and Research
entity_combined: United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR)
entity_description: The UN Institute for training and Research (UNITAR) provides short-term executive training to Members States' national and local government officials, and representatives of civil society and the private sector.
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council

entity_long: United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi
entity_combined: United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi (UNLB)
entity_description: The logistics base at Brindisi provides logistic support, telecommunications and training for all peacekeeping operations around the world.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Mission to Support the Hudaydah Agreement
entity_combined: United Nations Mission to Support the Hudaydah Agreement (UNMHA)
entity_description: UNMHA helps facilitate and coordinate UN support to assist the parties to fully implement the Hudaydah Agreement; leading and supporting the functioning of the Redeployment Coordination Committtee, monitoring the compliance of the parties of the ceasefire in the Hudayah governorate, and ensuring the region's security
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
head_of_entity_title_general: Officer in charge and acting chair

entity_long: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo
entity_combined: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)
entity_description: Following the declaration of independence by the Kosovo authorities in 2008, the UNMIK has been mandated to focus primarily on the promotion of security, stability and respect for human rights in Kosovo
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Mission in South Sudan
entity_combined: United Nations Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS)
entity_description: UNMISS' efforts in South Sudan focus on the protection of civilians, delivering humanitarian assistance, supporting the implementation of the revitalized agreement and the peace process, and monitoring and investigating human rights
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan
entity_combined: United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP)
entity_description: UNMOGIP supervises, in the State of Jammu and Kashmir, the ceasefire between India and Pakistan, and assists the Military Adviser to the United Nations Commission for India and Pakistan
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Office to the African Union
entity_combined: United Nations Office to the African Union (UNOAU)
entity_description: UNOAU is mandated to enhance the partnership between the United Nations and the African Union in the area of peace and security and provide United Nations advice to the African Union on both long-term capacity-building and short-term operational support
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa
entity_combined: United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa (UNOCA)
entity_description: UNOCA has a regional mandate to help prevent conflict and consolidate peace in Central Africa and provides assistance to support preventive diplomacy and mediation in situations of tension or potential conflict.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and United Nations Office at Vienna
entity_combined: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and United Nations Office at Vienna (UNODC)
entity_description: The UNODC is the secretariat of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention against Transnational Organized Crime and of the Conference of the States Parties to the UN Convention against Corruption.

entity_long: United Nations Office at Geneva
entity_combined: United Nations Office at Geneva (UNOG)
entity_description: The UNOG services more than 8,000 meetings every year, making it one of the busiest conference centres in the world. With more than 1,600 staff, it is the biggest duty stations outside of United Nations headquarters in New York.
head_of_entity_title_specific: Executive Director of the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and Director-General of the United Nations Office at Vienna

entity_long: United Nations Office at Nairobi
entity_combined: United Nations Office at Nairobi (UNON)
entity_description: The UNON performs representation and liaison functions and facilitates cooperation between with permanent missions, the host-country and other Governments, and intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations in Nairobi.

entity_long: United Nations Office for Project Services
entity_combined: United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS)
entity_description: UNOPS' mission is to expand the capacity of the UN system and its partners to implement peace building, humanitarian and development operations that matter for people in need.

entity_long: United Nations Office at Vienna
entity_combined: United Nations Office at Vienna (UNOV)
entity_description: The UNOV performs representation and liaison functions with permanent missions to the United Nations (Vienna), the host Government and intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations in Vienna.
annual_reports_link: No annual report (only from the SG)

entity_long: United Nations Office for West Africa and the Sahel
entity_combined: United Nations Office for West Africa and the Sahel (UNOWAS)
entity_description: UNOWAS has the responsibility for preventive diplomacy, good offices and political mediation and facilitation efforts in West Africa and the Sahel and works to consolidate peace and democratic governance in countries emerging from conflict or political crises.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia
entity_combined: United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia (UNRCCA)
entity_description: The UNRCCA implements the concept of preventive diplomacy in practice through enhanced dialogue, confidence building measures and genuine partnerships in responding to existing and emerging challenges in Central Asia.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Representative to the Geneva International Discussions
entity_combined: Office of the United Nations Representative to the Geneva International Discussions (UNRGID)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Register of Damage Caused by the Construction of the Wall in the Occupied Palestinian Territory
entity_combined: United Nations Register of Damage Caused by the Construction of the Wall in the Occupied Palestinian Territory (UNRoD)
entity_description: UNRoD's mandate is to serve as a record, in documentary form, of the damage caused to all natural and legal persons concerned as a result of the construction of the Wall by Israel in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
entity_combined: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA)
entity_description: The UNRWA carries out direct relief and works programmes for Palestine refugees.

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process
entity_combined: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process (UNSCO)
entity_description: The DPPA supports UN peacemaking efforts in various ways, including by advising and assisting the Secretary-General in his Middle East diplomacy and by overseeing UN political activities in the region.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for Lebanon
entity_combined: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for Lebanon (UNSCOL)
entity_description: The UNSCOL provides leadership and coordination to UN efforts in Lebanon, assistinng the country in forging a peaceful, stable and democratic future.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Support Mission in Libya
entity_combined: United Nations Support Mission in Libya (UNSMIL)
entity_description: UNSMIL, in full accordannce with the principles of national ownership, is an integrated special political mission that supports support Libya's new transitional authorities in their post-conflict efforts.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Assistance Mission in Somalia
entity_combined: United Nations Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNSOM)
entity_description: UNSOM works with the Government of Somalia to support national reconciliation, provide strategic and policy advice on peacebuilding and state-building, to monitor the human rights situation and help coordinate the efforts of the international community.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Support Office in Somalia
entity_combined: United Nations Support Office in Somalia (UNSOS)
entity_description: The UNSOS provides critical support to institutions in Somalia to make them more effective in defeating enemies of peace and in creating space for political reconciliation and state formation.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations System Staff College
entity_combined: United Nations System Staff College (UNSSC)
entity_description: The UNSSC delivers high-quality learning programmes and tailored solutions for UN staff and partners, equipping them with the knowledge and skills to support important UN activities and objectives.
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council

entity_long: United Nations Transitional Assistance Mission in Somalia
entity_combined: United Nations Transitional Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNTMIS)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Truce Supervision Organization
entity_combined: United Nations Truce Supervision Organization (UNTSO)
entity_description: UNTSO observers monitor ceasefires, supervise armistice agreements, prevent isolated incidents from escalating and assist other United Nations peacekeeping operations in the Middle East.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations University
entity_combined: United Nations University (UNU)
entity_description: The mission of the UN University is to contribute, through collaborative research and education, to efforts to resolve the pressing global problems of human survival, development and welfare.
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council
results_framework_link: No centralized RBM results framework found

entity_long: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia
entity_combined: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia (UNVMC)
entity_description: The Mission will verify the reintegration of former FARC-EP members into political, economic and social life and the security guarantees for former FARC-EP members, their families, and communities in the territories.
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Youth Office
entity_combined: United Nations Youth Office (UNYO)

entity_long: Universal Postal Union
entity_combined: Universal Postal Union (UPU)
entity_description: The UPU aims to secure the organisation and improvements of postal services, promote international collaboration and undertake technical assistance in postal matters requested by members countries.

entity_long: Office of the Victims' Rights Advocate
entity_combined: Office of the Victims' Rights Advocate (VRA)
head_of_entity_title_specific: Victims’ Rights Advocate

entity_long: World Bank
entity_combined: World Bank (WB)

entity_long: World Food Programme
entity_combined: World Food Programme (WFP)
entity_description: The WFP was established as the UN System's food aid organisation. It is the world's largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger worldwide.

entity_long: World Health Organization
entity_combined: World Health Organization (WHO)
entity_description: Article 1 of the Constitution defines the WHO's objective as "the attainment by all peoples of the highest possible level of health". The detailed functions are set out in article 2 of the Constitution.

entity_long: World Intellectual Property Organization
entity_combined: World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO)
entity_description: The WIPO is dedicated to developing a balanced and accessible international intellectual property system that stimulates innovation and contributes to economic development while safeguarding public interest.

entity_long: World Meteorological Organization
entity_combined: World Meteorological Organization (WMO)
entity_description: The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) is the successor to the International Meteorological Organization, which was established in 1873.

entity_long: World Trade Organization
entity_combined: World Trade Organization (WTO)
entity_description: The WTO is the only global international organization dealing with the rules of trade between nations. At its heart are the WTO agreements, negotiated and signed by the bulk of the world’s trading nations.
